snippet.title: Noosaville talent claims Australian junior longboard title
snippet.content: SURFING: Noosaville's Emily Lethbridge has been crowned the Australian junior longboard champion on a remarkable day for Sunshine Coasters at Tweed Heads. The talented youngster won the girls division after posting a score of 13.25 in a three-surfer final. She finished ahead of Noosa's Felicity Baker (13.25) and Mundurah's Zali Corry (4.30). There were a host of board riders from the Sunshine Coast in action on a bumper day of action at Cabarita Beach, as part of the Australian Longboard Titles. Lethbridge was also runner-up in the open women's section, with a score of 12, finishing behind Allambie Heights' Tully White. Noosa's Kirra Molnar also featured in the deciding heat. Coasters finished no worse than second in seven of the eight finals contested. Other runner-ups were Kawana's Clinton Guest (open loggers, Buderim's Jason Caldow (over-35 men), Noosa's Kirsty Quirk (over-35 women, Moffat Beach's Aiden Feely (junior logger and junior boys). Tweed Heads' Dane Pioli won the open men's crown, with a score 13.50 too good for Declan Wyton (11.55). There were two foot peaks on the final day of the four-day competition.
